verses.text: And when he had opened the seventh seal, there was silence in heaven about the space of half an hour.
And I saw the seven angels which stood before God; and to them were given seven trumpets.

And another angel came and stood at the altar, having a golden censer; and there was given unto him much incense, that he should offer \add it\add* with the prayers of all saints upon the golden altar which was before the throne.
And the smoke of the incense, \add which came\add* with the prayers of the saints, ascended up before God out of the angelâ€™s hand.
And the angel took the censer, and filled it with fire of the altar, and cast \add it\add* into the earth: and there were voices, and thunderings, and lightnings, and an earthquake.
And the seven angels which had the seven trumpets prepared themselves to sound.
The first angel sounded, and there followed hail and fire mingled with blood, and they were cast upon the earth: and the third \add part\add* of trees was burnt up, and all green grass was burnt up.
And the second angel sounded, and as \add it were\add* a great mountain burning with fire was cast into the sea: and the third \add part\add* of the sea became blood;
and the third \add part\add* of the creatures which were in the sea, and had life, died; and the third \add part\add* of the ships were destroyed.
And the third angel sounded, and there fell a great star from heaven, burning as \add it were\add* a lamp, and it fell upon the third \add part\add* of the rivers, and upon the fountains of waters;
and the name of the star is called Wormwood: and the third \add part\add* of the waters became wormwood; and many men died of the waters, because they were made bitter.

And the fourth angel sounded, and the third \add part\add* of the sun was smitten, and the third \add part\add* of the moon, and the third \add part\add* of the stars; so as the third \add part\add* of them was darkened and the day shone not for a third \add part\add* of it, and the night likewise.

And I beheld, and heard an angel flying through the midst of heaven, saying with a loud voice, Woe, woe, woe, to the inhabiters of the earth by reason of the other voices of the trumpet of the three angels, which are yet to sound.
